cards.name: Paras
cards.text: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Parasect
cards.text: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.

attacks.name: Colorful Spores
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a different type of basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Pinsir
cards.text: It swings its long antlers wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.

attacks.name: Overhead Throw
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Heavy Suplex
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Cacnea
cards.text: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Pansage
cards.text: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Simisage
cards.text: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

attacks.name: Fire Fling
attacks.text: Put 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hand Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Chespin
cards.text: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.

attacks.name: Nosh
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Chespin
cards.text: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.

cards.name: Chespin
cards.text: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

attacks.name: Tree Climb
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Quilladin
cards.text: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Chesnaught
cards.text: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

attacks.name: Spike Lariat
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Chesnaught BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Chesnaught BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Tough Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself. This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Scatterbug
cards.text: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Spewpa
cards.text: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Vivillon

abilities.name: Energy Color
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Skiddo
cards.text: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Gogoat
cards.text: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Horn Leech
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cyndaquil
cards.text: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Quilava
cards.text: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

attacks.name: Mini Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is an Energy card, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Typhlosion
cards.text: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur together to cause huge explosions.

attacks.name: Massive Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 80 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Flare Destroy
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. Then, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Houndoom-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Melting Horn
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: M Houndoom-EX

attacks.name: Inferno Fang
attacks.text: You may discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Pansear
cards.text: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Simisear
cards.text: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

attacks.name: Water Fling
attacks.text: Put 3 Water Energy from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hand Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Fennekin
cards.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Braixen
cards.text: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Goldeen
cards.text: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Seaking
cards.text: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.

attacks.name: Soaking Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.text: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

attacks.name: Continuous Spin
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Starmie
cards.text: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

attacks.name: Deep Sea Swirl
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 7 cards.

attacks.name: Balance Bind
attacks.text: If you and your opponent have the same number of Benched Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Remoraid
cards.text: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

attacks.name: Wild River
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Remoraid
cards.text: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

cards.name: Octillery

abilities.name: Abyssal Hand
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

cards.text: It traps foes with the suction cups on its tentacles, then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Glalie-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: M Glalie-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cryo Mouth
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has 10 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 150 more damage.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

cards.name: Prinplup
cards.text: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Empoleon

abilities.name: Dignified Fighter
abilities.text: Each of your Basic Pokémon's attacks does 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

cards.name: Snover
cards.text: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Abomasnow
cards.text: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

attacks.name: Ice Age
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, it is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Panpour
cards.text: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Simipour
cards.text: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

attacks.name: Green Fling
attacks.text: Put 3 Grass Energy from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hand Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Vanillite
cards.text: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Vanillish
cards.text: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

attacks.name: Ice Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Vanilluxe
cards.text: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

attacks.name: Frigid Breath
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, each player can't play any Supporter or Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Deep Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Froakie
cards.text: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

cards.name: Frogadier
cards.text: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity instantly downing foes several times its size.

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Magnemite

abilities.name: Sparkling Induction
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, its Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Magnemite on your Bench.

cards.text: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.

attacks.name: Shock Generator
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.

attacks.name: Static Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electro Ball
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Magnezone

abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Raikou

abilities.name: Shining Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Lightning Energy attached to it, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder Lance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Stunfisk
cards.text: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Dedenne
cards.text: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Gastly
cards.text: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

cards.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Gothic Fear
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may leave both Active Pokémon Confused.

cards.text: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim's life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Gengar
cards.text: Hiding in people's shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.

attacks.name: Sinister Fog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Creep Show
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has 3 or more damage counters on it, that Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Mewtwo-EX

cards.text: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

attacks.name: Curse Deeply

cards.name: Wobbuffet
cards.text: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

cards.name: Kirlia

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.text: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Moonlight Gain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Woobat
cards.text: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Swoobat
cards.text: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

cards.name: Elgyem
cards.text: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 20 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Beheeyem
cards.text: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Cubone

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle

cards.name: Marowak

cards.text: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

cards.text: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Zoroark BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Zoroark BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Foul Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Inkay
cards.text: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

attacks.name: Disorderly Flip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Yveltal

abilities.name: Fright Night
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, each Pokémon Tool card in play has no effect.

cards.text: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

attacks.name: Pitch-Black Spear
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Bronzong
cards.text: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Bench Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks.

cards.text: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.

attacks.name: Juggling
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Snubbull
cards.text: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Granbull
cards.text: It can make most any Pokémon run away simply by opening its mouth wide to reveal its big fangs.

attacks.name: Startling Bark
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 3 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

cards.name: Flabébé
cards.text: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

attacks.name: Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Floette
cards.text: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Florges

abilities.name: Calming Aroma
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon's attacks costs Fairy less.

cards.text: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

attacks.name: Wonder Shine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Florges BREAK

abilities.name: Floral Breeze
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage and remove a Special Condition from your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Florges BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

cards.name: Spritzee
cards.text: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Aromatisse
cards.text: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

attacks.name: Heavy Perfume
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. Put 6 damage counters instead of 3 on that Pokémon for this Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Xerneas
cards.text: When the horns on its head shine in seven different colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

attacks.name: Rainbow Force
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

attacks.name: Power Creation
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Axew
cards.text: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

cards.name: Axew
cards.text: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

attacks.name: Extra Chop
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Fraxure
cards.text: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

attacks.name: Dragon Slayer
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Haxorus
cards.text: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

attacks.name: Dragon Dance
attacks.text: As long as this Haxorus is your Active Pokémon, each of its attacks does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't add more than 100 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Noivern
cards.text: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It emerges out of the dark to attack.

attacks.name: Tuning
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Noivern BREAK
cards.text: BREAK Evolution Rule: Noivern BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Synchro Woofer
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

attacks.name: Exhausted Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.text: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.name: Simultaneous Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Doduo Delivery
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.text: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Doduo Delivery
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.

cards.text: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Plump Body
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Hoothoot
cards.text: It always stand on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

attacks.name: Proclaim the Night
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

cards.name: Noctowl
cards.text: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

attacks.name: High Flight
attacks.text: Each player reveals his or her hand. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Item cards revealed.

cards.name: Teddiursa
cards.text: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

cards.name: Ursaring
cards.text: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Smeargle

abilities.name: Second Coat
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch a basic Energy card attached to your Active Pokémon with a different type of basic Energy card from your discard pile.

cards.text: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

attacks.name: Bind Wound
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Starly
cards.text: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

attacks.name: Call for Pals
attacks.text: Search your deck for as many Starly as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Staravia
cards.text: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Staraptor
cards.text: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

attacks.name: Cyclone Slash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brave Bird
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Chatot
cards.text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

cards.name: Braviary
cards.text: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Noibat
cards.text: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Noibat
cards.text: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Mysterious Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Assault Vest
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Any damage done to the Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy attached to them is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Brigette
cards.text: Search your deck for 1 Basic Pokémon-EX or 3 Basic Pokémon (except for Pokémon-EX) and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Buddy-Buddy Rescue
cards.text: Each player puts a Pokémon from his or her discard pile into his or her hand. (Your opponent chooses first.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fisherman
cards.text: Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Float Stone
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Giovanni's Scheme
cards.text: Choose 1: • Draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. • During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Glalie Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Glalie-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Heavy Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of 3 or more, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Heavy Boots
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is 3 or more, that Pokémon gets +20 HP and can't be Confused. (If that Pokémon is currently Confused, remove that Special Condition.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Houndoom Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Houndoom-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Judge
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Mewtwo Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Mewtwo-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Parallel City
cards.text: Choose which way this card faces before you play it. This ↓ player can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. (When this card comes into play, this ↓ player discards Benched Pokémon until he or she has 3 Pokémon on the Bench.),Choose which way this card faces before you play it. Any damage done by attacks from this ↓ player's Grass, Fire, or Water Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Professor's Letter
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Professor's Letter
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Reserved Ticket
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Skyla
cards.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Super Rod
cards.text: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Town Map
cards.text: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Burning Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Fire Pokémon. This card provides Fire Energy only while this card is attached to a Fire Pokémon.,If this card is discarded by an attack of the Fire Pokémon this card is attached to, attach this card from your discard pile to that Pokémon after attacking.,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Fire Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
